title: Enthusiastic employee catches coworkers deprecating teammate’s looks and love life after months of believing in genuine office friendships leads to personality-free workspace and late-night job applications
description: The sweet innocence of believing coworkers are your chosen family. It's like watching a caveman discover fire, adorable, predictable, and doomed to end in tears.You marched into that office with the wide-eyed optimism of a golden retriever at a barbecue, convinced that helpfulness and friendship would earn you a spot in the sacred inner circle. Bless your heart. waltzed into that office, armed with a "positive attitude" and a LinkedIn-inspired belief that "teamwork makes the dream work." Adorable. So absolutely adorable.Let's cut to the chase here, offices are glorified daycare centers for adults. The close-knit team bonding over lukewarm pizza and forced happy hours, although looks very appealing, is less camaraderie and more Stockholm syndrome.But sure, your coworkers are different. You've got nicknames! You've decorated your cubicle with funny memes! Oh, honey. Then came the wake-up call: overhearing your "work fam" filet a colleague's life choices with the precision of a master fish butcher. But don't worry—they'd never talk about you like that. Except, of course, they absolutely would.
author: Etai Eshet
excerpt: Enthusiastic employee catches coworkers deprecating teammate’s looks and love life after months of believing in genuine office friendships leads to personality-free workspace and late-night job applications - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: Of course, I’d never fall for this. I’m far too wise. Except that one time, when I organized a “friendship bracelet” crafting hour during lunch. For the entire department. With personalized initials. And a PowerPoint on “synergy.” Look, I thought we were bonding. It’s fine, I’m fine. It was just a tiny breakdown wear I stripped my cubicle’s “Inspiration Corner” (RIP motivational cat posters), sobbing into a stress ball shaped like the company logo, asked my boss where the ‘office mental fatigue relieving space’ was, and rage-applying to jobs on Indeed during my wellness break, known by my coworkers as “bathroom ugly-cry sesh,” But It’s fine, I’m fine!
html:
Of course, I’d never fall for this. I’m far too wise. Except that one time, when I organized a “friendship bracelet” crafting hour during lunch. For the entire department. With personalized initials. And a PowerPoint on “synergy.” Look, I thought we were bonding. It’s fine, I’m fine.

It was just a tiny breakdown wear I stripped my cubicle’s “Inspiration Corner” (RIP motivational cat posters), sobbing into a stress ball shaped like the company logo, asked my boss where the ‘office mental fatigue relieving space’ was, and rage-applying to jobs on Indeed during my wellness break, known by my coworkers as “bathroom ugly-cry sesh,” But It’s fine, I’m fine!
